name: Catedral de León
address: Plaza de Regla, s/n, 24003 León, Spain
description: Also known as the 'House of Light,' this magnificent Gothic cathedral is one of Spain's most important landmarks. It's renowned for its stunning stained-glass windows, which cover over 1,800 square meters and create a breathtaking display of light and color.

name: Casa Botines
address: Plaza de San Marcelo, 5, 24003 León, Spain
description: A modernist masterpiece by the famous architect Antoni Gaudí, Casa Botines is one of only a few of his works outside of Catalonia. The building, with its distinctive turrets and neo-Gothic style, now houses a museum dedicated to the building's history, Gaudí, and a collection of art.

name: Basílica de San Isidoro
address: Plaza de San Isidoro, 4, 24003 León, Spain
description: This is a jewel of Romanesque art and a must-see for anyone interested in medieval history. The basilica features the Royal Pantheon, a vaulted chamber with incredible frescoes that have earned it the nickname 'the Sistine Chapel of Romanesque Art.'

name: MUSAC (Museo de Arte Contemporáneo de Castilla y León)
address: Av. de los Reyes Leoneses, 24, 24008 León, Spain
description: The Museum of Contemporary Art of Castilla y León is an award-winning museum and a significant modern architectural landmark. Its colorful, mosaic-like facade is a work of art in itself, and the museum houses an important collection of contemporary art from the region.

name: Convento de San Marcos
address: Plaza de San Marcos, 6, 24002 León, Spain
description: Originally a 12th-century pilgrim hostel, this impressive building was rebuilt in the 16th century in the Plateresque style. Its ornate facade is a prime example of Spanish Renaissance architecture, and today it operates as a luxury hotel and a national monument.

name: Plaza Mayor
description: The heart of León's historic center, the Plaza Mayor is a classic Spanish main square. Surrounded by two-story arcaded buildings and home to the old town hall, it's a vibrant hub for cafes, bars, and local life, particularly in the evening.

name: Palacio de los Guzmanes
address: Plaza de San Marcelo, 6, 24003 León, Spain
description: This beautiful 16th-century Renaissance palace is located right next to Casa Botines. It features an impressive facade and a striking courtyard, and now serves as the headquarters for the provincial government.

name: Barrio Húmedo
address: Around Plaza de San Martín, 24003 León, Spain
description: León's famous 'Wet Quarter' is the city's most lively area, known for its narrow streets, historic buildings, and incredible tapas scene. It's a fantastic place to wander from bar to bar, enjoying complimentary tapas with your drinks and experiencing the local culture.
